meanings.definition: Situated or lying on top of something else
meanings.sent1: The overlying blanket kept me warm during the cold night.
meanings.sent2: The overlying clouds blocked the sun, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent3: The overlying cat thought it was the king of the house, sitting on every surface.
meanings.sent4: The overlying silence in the room was broken by a sudden loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The overlying snow on the mountain sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The overlying leaves provided shade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: The overlying fog obscured the view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The overlying scarf was so long it wrapped around her neck twice.
meanings.sent4: The overlying darkness of the night made it hard to see anything.
meanings.sent5: The overlying sand covered the beach like a golden blanket.

meanings.sent1: The overlying bridge connected the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent2: The overlying branches of the tree provided shelter from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The overlying road seemed to stretch endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent4: The overlying power lines crisscrossed above the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The overlying vines twisted and turned over the garden wall.
